intro: Lysipomia bourgoinii, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lysipomia bourgoinii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
